intro: Pentstemonopsis tweedyi, commonly known as Tweedy's pentstemon, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant is herbaceous, with upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
